v.v: I say that my enemies have afflicted me ever since I was young.
“Our enemies have afflicted us since our nation began,
Our enemies struck us with whips that cut into our backs
I wish that they may all be shamed because we will defeat them—all of Jerusalem’s enemies.
I hope that they may be of no value, like grass that grows on the roofs of houses,
no one wants to cut it and tie it up as bundles and carry it away.
People who pass by and see men harvesting grain usually greet them by saying to them,

v: Now I ask you, my fellow Israelites, to repeat those same words:
but they have not defeated us!
as a farmer uses a plow to cuts deep furrows into the ground.”
and he has freed us from being slaves to wicked people.
that dries up and does not grow tall;
“We wish that Yahweh may bless you!”
But this will not happen to the enemies of Israel.
We, acting as Yahweh’s representatives, bless you, our fellow Israelites!
